Simon Belin.action: Lindner (Simon Belin) reaches in through the hatch and grabs a hold of Martin to help pull him out of the cellar.
Simon Belin.assessment: Simon Belin's quick and decisive action to help Martin shows a caring and protective nature, indicating warmth.

Simon Belin.action: Despite the danger, Simon Belin climbs down into the cellar to search for Ellen when she disappears underwater.
Simon Belin.assessment: His willingness to risk his own safety to help Ellen demonstrates bravery and genuine concern, reflecting a high level of warmth.

Simon Belin.action: Simon Belin keeps calm and reassures Ellen by telling her not to worry and that the black mass only has power if they run away.
Simon Belin.assessment: His calm and reassuring demeanor in a crisis shows emotional support and trustworthiness, positive indicators of warmth.

Simon Belin.action: Simon Belin stops Ellen from looking back as she escapes, prioritizing her safety over her emotional need to look back.
Simon Belin.assessment: This protective behavior shows care and concern for Ellen's well-being, indicating warmth.
